ratings.comment: Prof. Buenger is clearly knowledgeable about her topic, and a respected professor. However, she's also incredibly boring. It doesn't really matter if you pay attention in lecture or even attend at all, you can make it through the text. Makes you memorize long abstracts of text for quizzes, which is pointless, and her tests are unnecessarily hard.

She might be top-notch in her field, but she is a poor lecturer. Dry and boring, it was the class I used to catch up on sleep. Her sarcasm can be very offensive at times, and she is not very funny. If you have any opinion that does not mimic hers, I wouldn't share it. Any slight interest I had in art history has been diminished by her. Good luck.

Really intresting class. A distracted lecturer but very intelligent and intresting. Relatively easy course, very fair quizzes and exams. Gives excellent feedback for the papers and is a generous grader. INsane abouts of reading expected but you can get by if you don't read all of it.

Monotonous. My sleeping class. Despite that, very informative and interested to convey her lessons. Might use some "artistic" terms that needs to be clarified later. Needs long periods of concentration. Has a lot of extra credit.

She is very knowledgeable and very nice, however she talks very monotone and is very boring to listen to so lecture was difficult. The overall class is very broad so a lot of info is thrown at you. Exams were unclear as to what was expected of you, make sure to give evidence for EVERY argument you make and the papers were fairly easy.
I went into this class wanting to be an Art History major and her teaching ruined my interest. Disorganized, monotone, and irrelevant in lecture. I depended solely on my TA for pertinent information.

Lecture is unorganized and filled with a lot of information that won't be on the test. She is unclear about what is knowledge is needed to do well in the class. Professor says she will give certain resources to class but hands out study guides two days before exam. Impossible to prep because she is so lazy.

I absolutely LOVE Prof. Buenger.  Her subject knowledge is vast, and she has a delightful sense of humor.  She's a straight shooter when it came to advising me about graduate school before I chose my program.  Can be a little absent-minded sometimes, and forgot to show up for a class we had one day, but she's clearly top notch in her field.

I found her to be very clear in what she expected you to know for the exams, however they were difficult - so know the material well. Readings were tedious and not always necessary and the writing assignments were unfortunately vague. Overall though she was pretty interesting & a fair grader.

I cannot praise Prof. Buenger enough for making our class interesting and thought-provoking.  Her class drove my interest in modern German art, and I think she is one of the best scholars in her field.  She is extemely interested in the writing skills of her students so her classes require a lot of self-discipline and hard work.

Professor Buenger was over all an extremely nice lady.  She tried to get everyone engaged in the material and knew it well, even though she sometimes sounded like she was talking to herself.  Strict grader and picked out everything as wrong but ended up giving people better grades for trying.  Took my class to dinner, fig 09 was her pride and joy.

Overall an underwhelming professor. Clearly intelligent, but lectures are achingly boring and she often includes historical anecdotes so specfic that one ceases to care. Lectured past the end of class every single day - most students just walked out as she talked away. Exams are moderately challenging, and perhaps a good place to actually learn.

This class was part of my FIG. She's a tough grader, and you don't always know what she wants, but she helped me with my career path a TON. Wrote intern recommendations, took my class out to dinner, took us to Chicago, and plans to invite us to parties at her house next year. She's a good person.
Worst class I've ever taken.  Anything I learned came from work I did on my own time outside of lecture.

Complete lack of guidance in all aspects of the course.  Assigns VAST amounts of readings with no goals in mind.  Lectures are dry, full of useless tangents, and usually run 5-10 minutes past the end of class.  Despite her lofty claims about education she only wants you to regurgitate her opinions back to her.  Killed my love for art history.
She's entertaining to listen to, but really not helpful when it comes to answering questions. It is always unclear what she's looking for, and she doesn't seem to listen when you're talking.

Professor Buenger's "agenda" was no more obtrusive than any other professor's, I thought. She's exceptionally learned in her subject areas, and keeps her students on their feet when it comes to engaging the material. I recommend her classes highly, especially if you want in-depth insight into modern European art.
She knows her stuff and will do just about anything to help you know it too.

I found Buenger a bitter, self-absorbed second-rate scholar--her work on Beckmann notwithstanding--but she had an "agenda" the size of Cleveland and if you didn't fall into lock-step with her, she graded you poorly no matter how fine your work.
Hey friendly and understanding.  Can rush a bit, but she knows her stuff all from her head, doesn't rely heavily on notes, funny, likes to point out interesting facts.  Reasonable grader.
No Comments
The best professor I've ever had, she rocks!
Goes a little quick & expects a lot, but is overall a good teacher
Makes art history very accessable, great dry sense of humor
